title.ulink: Pascal Bleser: Oracle related packages for openSUSE

blockquote.para: Petr Vanek and I are maintaining some packages for openSUSE (and SLE) that build against the Oracle Instant Client libraries (I mean Oracle the database). Now, those libraries are not open source in any way, but are available from the Oracle TechNet website.

There are a few open source projects that are of interest, at least for people who have to work with the Oracle database, and we do package a few of them and Petr makes them available in his repository.
As of now, they're all built against version 10.2 of Oracle Instant Client, for openSUSE 11.3, openSUSE 11.4, Factory (snapshot) and SLE 11.

title.ulink: Sascha Manns: New Packages in the Build Service

blockquote.para: The last Week was very busy. I filled the Wiki in http://wiki.open-slx.de with new Articles about Games. You can find it (sadly just in german) there: http://wiki.open-slx.de/Spiele. Now we have 1774 Articles round about openSUSE.

Then i've got a Bugreport bnc#712471. Then i've made with help from Larry Finger from the Testing Team a couple of patches. Now after some tries we have now a final patch which we have committed to Factory and to the Upstream Project. They answered and would like to include the Patch into the next Version 0.9.0. This new Patch allows to run bleachbit under Kernel 3.x Series. You can update bleachbit through the "utilities" Repository or via 1-Klick. (...)

A few days ago the Banshee developers have released another unstable release of Banshee, 2.1.3. I’ve submitted this version already to the Banshee:Unstable repositories and to GNOME:Apps for update in openSUSE Factory.
For all of those interested, here’s the Release Notes…
